title: Quiz 6: Nutrition & Patient Needs
description: Assessment on patient needs (Physical, Spiritual, Social, Psychological) and nutritional management.

questions.question: Match the food category to its function:

richContent.content:
CategoryExample
Body BuildingBeans, Meat
Energy GivingMaize, Potatoes
ProtectiveFruits, Vegetables

questions.explanation: Proteins build body; Carbs give energy; Vitamins/minerals protect.
questions.hint: Building blocks vs Fuel vs Shield.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered 'High Risk' signs regarding nutrition? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Weight loss of >10% in less than 2 weeks

questions.explanation: Rapid weight loss, pain on swallowing, and diarrhoea are high risk. Increased appetite is generally positive.
questions.hint: Signs that prevent intake or cause loss.

questions.question: To manage ___BLANK___ (loose bowels), patients should eat soft mashed foods, eat small frequent meals, and drink plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration.
questions.explanation: Diarrhoea management involves fluid replacement and soft, easily digestible foods.

questions.question: Which nutritional advice is appropriate for a patient with a sore mouth/throat?

options.text: Avoid citrus and spicy foods; eat cold/room temp food
Eat dry, crunchy foods like toast

questions.explanation: Spicy, hot, or acidic foods irritate sores. Cold/room temp and soft foods are soothing.

questions.question: Match the patient need to the correct category:
questions.explanation: Categorizing needs helps in holistic care planning.
questions.hint: Body vs. Soul vs. Society vs. Mind.

questions.question: Orphans only require basic needs like food and shelter; they do not need legal intervention for property inheritance.
questions.explanation: Orphans specifically need legal interventions for property inheritance and protection from exploitation, in addition to basic needs.

questions.question: Which lifestyle measure is crucial for preventing Type 2 Diabetes?

options.text: Maintaining appropriate weight and physical activity

questions.explanation: Weight control, diet, and exercise are key to preventing Type 2 diabetes.

questions.question: Order the hierarchy of needs (loosely based on Maslow as applied to HBC):
questions.explanation: Basic needs must be met before higher-level needs like social interaction or spiritual growth can be fully addressed.
